gurmukhi: ਚਰਨ ਸਰਨਿ ਗੁਰ ਤੀਰਥ ਪੁਰਬ ਕੋਟਿ ਦੇਵੀ ਦੇਵ ਸੇਵ ਗੁਰ ਚਰਨਿ ਸਰਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Charan Sarani Gur Teerad Purab Koti , Dayvee Dayv Sayv Gur Charani Saran Hai ?
translation: Refuge of a True Guru is equivalent to pilgrimage of millions of holy places. Service of millions of gods and goddesses is also equivalent to living in the service of True Guru.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਨ ਸਰਨਿ ਗੁਰ ਕਾਮਨਾ ਸਕਲ ਫਲ ਰਿਧਿ ਸਿਧਿ ਨਿਧਿ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਅਮਰਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Charan Sarani Gur Kaamanaa Sakal Dhala , Ridhi Sidhi Nidhi Avataar Amaran Hai ?
translation: All desires fructify in the holy refuge of True Guru. All the miraculous powers remain in attendance forever.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਨ ਸਰਨਿ ਗੁਰ ਨਾਮ ਨਿਹਕਾਮ ਧਾਮ ਭਗਤਿ ਜੁਗਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਤਾਰਨ ਤਰਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Charan Sarani Gur Naam Nihakaam Dhaama , Bhagati Jougati Kari Taaran Taran Hai ?
translation: Meditation on Lord's name carried out in the refuge of the True Guru but with no reward at the back of the mind, is the place of all the comforts and peace in the world. A devoted Sikh absorbs himself in Naam Simran and sails across the worldly ocean besi

gurmukhi: ਚਰਨ ਸਰਨਿ ਗੁਰ ਮਹਿਮਾ ਅਗਾਧਿ ਬੋਧ ਹਰਨ ਭਰਨ ਗਤਿ ਕਾਰਨ ਕਰਨ ਹੈ ||੭੨||
transliteration: Charan Sarani Gur Mahimaa Agaadhi Bodha , Haran Bharan Gati Kaaran Karan Hai ?72?
translation: The glory of the refuge of a True Guru is beyond perception. Like eternal Lord, it destroys all base deeds and vices and fills a person with virtues. (72)
